com.intel.util.power

Class BatteryStatus

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intel.util.power.BatteryStatus

  • @NotThreadSafe
public final class BatteryStatus
extends java.lang.Object
    Simple helper class for battery status information, such as battery level and charging status.

    This class is mutable and its internal state is snapshotted when update() is called. Post-construction, this object is invalid until update() is called.

    In certain rare circumstances, reading the battery level can fail. In those instances, this class assumes fail-safe defaults that the battery is completely discharged (e.g. level 0) and the device is not charging.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BatteryStatus

        public BatteryStatus(@NonNull
                     android.content.Context context)
        Parameters:
        context - Application context.

      • BatteryStatus

        @VisibleForTesting(value=PRIVATE)
public BatteryStatus(@NonNull
                                                       android.content.Context context,
                                                       boolean hasBattery,
                                                       int batteryLevel,
                                                       int batteryVoltage,
                                                       boolean isDischarging)
        Constructor for testing that allows the battery status manager to be initialized as if update() were called and the battery has the provided details.

        If this constructor is used, the BatteryStatus will behave normally once update() is actually called.

        Parameters:
        context - Application context.
        hasBattery - true if a battery is present, false if a battery is not present.
        batteryLevel - The battery level in the range [ BATTERY_PERCENTAGE_MINIMUM_INCLUSIVE, BATTERY_PERCENTAGE_MAXIMUM_INCLUSIVE.
        batteryVoltage - The battery voltage in millivolts.
        isDischarging - True if the battery is discharging, false if the battery is not discharging.

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update()
        Refresh and snapshot the battery state.

      • hasBattery

        public boolean hasBattery()
        Determines whether the device has a battery, as of the last time update() was called.
        Returns:
        True if battery is present. False if battery is not present.

      • getBatteryLevel

        public int getBatteryLevel()
        Returns:
        The battery level as a percentage in the range [ BATTERY_PERCENTAGE_MINIMUM_INCLUSIVE, BATTERY_PERCENTAGE_MAXIMUM_INCLUSIVE] as of the last time update() was called.

      • getBatteryVoltage

        public int getBatteryVoltage()
        Returns:
        The battery voltage in millivolts as of the last time update() was called.

      • isDischarging

        public boolean isDischarging()
        Returns:
        The charging status, as of the last time update() was called. True indicates the device is discharging, false indicates the device is charging.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        The internal state of the battery status manager for debugging purposes.

      • getBatteryIntent

        @VisibleForTesting(value=PRIVATE)
 @Nullable
protected static android.content.Intent getBatteryIntent(@NonNull
                                                                                                      android.content.Context context)
        Helper method to get the current battery Intent.
        Parameters:
        context - Application context.
        Returns:
        The most recent sticky Intent for Intent.ACTION_BATTERY_CHANGED or null if the battery Intent could not be read for any reason.

      • getBatteryPercentage

        public static int getBatteryPercentage(@NonNull
                                       android.content.Intent intent)
        Helper method to retrieve the battery percentage from Intent.ACTION_BATTERY_CHANGED.

        This method uses fail-safe defaults, so if there is a problem reading the battery percentage then this method will return BATTERY_PERCENTAGE_MINIMUM_INCLUSIVE.

        Parameters:
        intent - Intent.ACTION_BATTERY_CHANGED Intent.
        Returns:
        The battery level on a scale of [ BATTERY_PERCENTAGE_MINIMUM_INCLUSIVE, BATTERY_PERCENTAGE_MAXIMUM_INCLUSIVE].

      • getBatteryVoltage

        public static int getBatteryVoltage(@NonNull
                                    android.content.Intent intent)
        Helper method to retrieve the battery voltage from Intent.ACTION_BATTERY_CHANGED.

        This method assumes the returned value is in millivolts.

        Parameters:
        intent - Intent.ACTION_BATTERY_CHANGED Intent.
        Returns:
        The battery voltage in millivolts.

      • isBatteryPresent

        @VisibleForTesting(value=PRIVATE)
protected static boolean isBatteryPresent(@NonNull
                                                                            android.content.Intent intent)
        Helper method to determine whether a battery is present from Intent.ACTION_BATTERY_CHANGED.
        Parameters:
        intent - Intent.ACTION_BATTERY_CHANGED Intent.
        Returns:
        True if a battery is present. False if a battery is not present.

      • isBatteryDischarging

        public static boolean isBatteryDischarging(@NonNull
                                           android.content.Intent intent)
        Helper method to retrieve the battery discharging state from Intent.ACTION_BATTERY_CHANGED.
        Parameters:
        intent - Intent.ACTION_BATTERY_CHANGED Intent.
        Returns:
        True if the battery is discharging. This method uses fail-safe defaults, so if there is a problem reading the battery state then this method will report that the battery is discharging.
